001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Entity;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.EstimationFunction;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.TrainableFunction;
007
008import java.util.Map;
009import java.util.Set;
010
011/**
012 * Represents a neural network as a specific kind of {@link EstimationFunction}.
013 * <p>
014 * A neural network consists of multiple layers of {@link Neuron}s connected
015 * through weighted edges. This interface exposes structural information
016 * (layers, neurons, connections) and parameter management. It does not
017 * prescribe a specific network architecture (e.g., fully connected,
018 * convolutional, recurrent).
019 * </p>
020 *
021 * <h2>Responsibilities:</h2>
022 * <ul>
023 *   <li>Expose the <b>topology</b> of the network in terms of layers and neurons.</li>
024 *   <li>Provide access to <b>parameters</b> (weights, biases) for training
025 *       and persistence.</li>
026 *   <li>Inherit evaluation capabilities from {@link EstimationFunction},
027 *       such as mapping inputs to outputs.</li>
028 * </ul>
029 */
030@DomainObject
031@Entity
032public interface NeuralNetwork extends TrainableFunction<Float> {
033
034    /**
035     * Returns the number of neurons in the given layer.
036     *
037     * @param l the layer index (0-based, where 0 is the input layer)
038     * @return the number of neurons in that layer
039     * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the layer index is invalid
040     */
041    int getWidth(int l);
042
043    /**
044     * Returns the total number of layers in the network, including input and output layers.
045     *
046     * @return the depth of the network
047     */
048    int getDepth();
049
050    /**
051     * Returns a specific neuron in the network by its layer and index.
052     *
053     * @param l the layer index (0-based)
054     * @param j the index of the neuron within the layer (0-based)
055     * @return the neuron at the specified position
056     * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the indices are invalid
057     */
058    Neuron getNeuron(int l, int j);
059
060    /**
061     * Returns a specific neuron in the network by its layer and index.
062     *
063     * @param l         the layer index (0-based)
064     * @param j         the index of the neuron within the layer (0-based)
065     * @param classType the class of the neuron to be returned
066     * @return the neuron at the specified position
067     * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the indices are invalid
068     */
069    <N extends Neuron> N getNeuron(int l, int j, Class<N> classType);
070
071    /**
072     * Returns the outgoing connections of a given neuron in the network.
073     * <p>
074     * Each connection is represented as a mapping from a target neuron
075     * to the weight of the connection.
076     * </p>
077     *
078     * @param l the layer index of the source neuron
079     * @param j the index of the source neuron within the layer
080     * @return a map of target neurons to their associated connection weights
081     */
082    Map<Neuron, Float> getOutputConnections(int l, int j);
083
084    /**
085     * Returns the target neurons of the given neuron (thus the downstream nodeds).
086     *
087     * @param neuron the neuron for which the targets are returned
088     * @return the target neurons
089     */
090    Set<Neuron> getTargetNeurons(Neuron neuron);
091
092    /**
093     * Returns the total number of trainable parameters in the network
094     * (typically weights + biases).
095     *
096     * @return the number of parameters
097     */
098    int getParameterCount();
099
100    /**
101     * Returns all parameters (weights, biases) of the network as a flat array.
102     * <p>
103     * The order of parameters is implementation-defined but must be consistent
104     * across calls to enable saving and restoring network state.
105     * </p>
106     *
107     * @return a flat array of parameters
108     */
109    Float[] getParameters();
110
111    /**
112     * Accepts a {@link net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.NeuronVisitor} to traverse
113     * the structure of this neural network.
114     * This allows external visitors to analyze, transform, or export the
115     * network structure without coupling to its internal implementation.
116     *
117     * @param visitor the visitor to apply to this network
118     */
119    void accept(NeuronVisitor visitor);
120
121}
